description.narrative: Crusader Resources Ltd. (Crusader or the Company) is a junior mineral exploration company organized and existing under the laws of Western Australia, Australia. The Company is focused on the development of the Borborema Gold Project (Borborema or the Project) located in Rio Grande do Norte, in Northeastern Brazil. Borborema, Crusaders flagship project, is an advance gold exploration project which has a gold resource of 2.43Moz of which 1.6Moz (@1.18 g/t) are classified as reserves. The Project is at the feasibility stage and Crusader is currently conducting an optimization study to determine the Projects optimal size. The Project hosts the old San Francisco mine which operated in the 1980s and produced 100,000 ounces of gold. IFCs investment will support the optimization study on Borborema and further exploration in the Serido belt in which the Project is located.

The proposed investment is considered an early-stage investment preceding a project construction decision. Generally, pre-construction stage projects have limited development impacts. The expected development impacts during the construction and production phases would include: (i) Supporting local economic development through the generation of direct and indirect employment opportunities to the communities of Currais Novo and Campo Redondo. (ii) Fiscal receipts in the form of taxes, royalties and foreign exchange. (iii) Development of Community investment programs; and (iv) Demonstration effect to other mining companies on how to develop large-scale commercial mining in accordance with good international industry practices.
